intro: Doronicum linifolium, commonly known as the slender leaved globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange, typically in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Doronicum linifolium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and woodland edges.
